title: Best cycling deals 2023: Save £1,600 on a Cannondale, plus £13 helmets and 61% off ex-pro bikes
content:
Cyclist
Best cycling deals 2023: Save £1,600 on a Cannondale, plus £13 helmets and 61% off ex-pro bikes

Like David Dickinson in a Herefordshire auction room, we go mad for a bargain here at Cyclist. From bike computers to helmets, winter jackets to turbo trainers, we’ve hand-picked some of the best deals on bikes and cycling goods available right now. If nothing takes your fancy now, keep checking back as we keep this page regularly updated.

Best cycling deals UK

Components

  • Shimano 105 R7000 11-speed rim brake groupset
  • Tifosi HG 12-speed cassette
  • Continental GP5000 clincher tyre twin pack
  • Shimano 105 R7000 carbon road pedals
  • WTB Riddler TCS Fast tyres 700x45mm
  • Selle Italia Diva gel flow saddle

Bikes

  • Bike-Room ex-team bikes
  • Wilier Garda Ultegra road bike 2023
  • Pinnacle Laterite 1 road bike
  • Cannondale Topstone carbon Rival AXS gravel bike
  • Specialized Diverge E5 Elite gravel bike 2022

Clothing

  • Bell Tracker helmet
  • Poc Omne Air Spin helmet
  • GripGrab Cloudburst waterproof mid-season gloves
  • Sportful Supergiara women’s short sleeve jersey
  • Castelli Perfetto RoS Light men’s short sleeve jersey
  • MAAP Women’s Ascend Pro rain jacket
  • dhb Aeron Lab men’s thermal jersey
  • Sportful Tempo women’s jacket
  • Specialized S-Works 7 lace road shoes

Accessories

  • Elite Custom Race Plus resin bottle cage
  • Bontrager Ion 120/Flare 1 light set
  • SiS Go Isotonic energy gel 30 pack
  • Scicon Aerotech Evolution X TSA bike travel case
  • LifeLine Pro trainer table

Components

Shimano 105 R7000 11-speed rim brake groupset

Was £599.99, now £339.99 – save 43%

Shimano 105 is the go-to groupset for riders who want the key features of Dura-Ace and Ultegra, but at a more real-world price.

Since the pandemic caused a component drought, meaningful discounts on groupsets have been hard to come by. This is the cheapest 105 groupset we’ve seen in literally years. Don’t hang about if you want one.

  • Read our Shimano 105 R7000 review
  • Buy now from Wiggle (£339.99)

Tifosi HG 12-speed cassette

Was £79.99, now £29.99 – save 62%

With the big three groupset manufacturers now all offering 12-speed options, the aftermarket is catching on. Tifosi makes Shimano/SRAM-compatible cassettes, a useful affordable alternative in a world of largely brand-specific systems.

The steel HG cassette can be used on road, gravel and mountain bikes, and is currently over 60% off.

  • Buy now from Wiggle (£29.99)

Continental GP5000 clincher tyre twin pack

Was £119.98, now from £66.99 – save 44%

From the most popular cycling tyre dynasty of all time, Continental’s GP5000 is pretty much the ideal all-around tyre doing that tough task of perfectly mixing puncture protection, rolling resistance, grip and durability in a product that can genuinely be used 365 days a year.

Note these are the clincher version, not their tubeless siblings.

  • Buy from ProBikeKit (from £66.99)

Shimano 105 R7000 carbon road pedals

Was £124.99, now £73.99 – save 41%

Many of the products you’ll find on this list are luxuries, but pedals are a necessity, and these are good pedals with a good saving.

We don’t need to sell the benefits of Shimano pedals, if you use SPL-SL then you know what you’re getting in terms of setup and feel, the only bit of info you might need is the 105s weigh a claimed 285g for a pair.

  • Buy now from ProBikeKit (£73.99)

WTB Riddler TCS Fast tyres 700 x 45mm

Was £44.99, now £16.99 – save 62%

Are your gravel tyres on the brink of exhaustion but cost is stopping you buying some new rubber? The WTB Riddler TCS Fast tyres are currently more than 60% off in 700 x 45mm, a price that is pretty hard to argue with.

Though they are designed for gravel, WTB says they can also handle cyclocross courses and, with Dual DNA rubber compounds, the tyres aim to strike a good balance of durability, grip and speed.

  • Buy now from Wiggle (£16.99)

Selle Italia Diva gel flow saddle

Was £99.99, now £24.99 – save 75%

Available in three different finishes, the Diva gel flow by Selle Italia is a women-specific saddle, aimed at keeping you comfortable on those long rides. It utilises differentiated-thickness padding and gel inserts, as well as a cut-out to relieve pressure.

The saddle received high praise in our recent review, which called it ‘comfortable, supportive, and priced well.’

  • Read our Selle Italia Diva gel flow saddle review
  • Buy now from Wiggle (£24.99)

Bikes

Bike-Room ex-team bikes

We often talk about trickle-down technology in the cycling industry in a metaphorical sense but you can actually get your hands on some former pro kit at Bike-Room. Based in Milan, Bike-Room receives team-owned bikes from the previous season, and inspects and verifies them ready for resale.

Given that second-hand bikes are a great way to save money but can be hit-and-miss in quality, Bike-Room aims to remove that uncertainty and help riders get pro-level kit at great value-for-money.

The workshop receives bikes from a different team every two weeks, with two rounds of bikes uploaded to the website each month, including offers such as 55% off a Lotto Soudal Ridley Helium or 53% off a Team DSM Scott Plasma.

  • Buy now from Bike-Room

Wilier Gardo Ultegra road bike 2023

Was £3,999, now £2,499 – save 38%

It’s not often you get current models at such a discount, but this 2023 Wilier Garda is almost 40% at Merlin Cycles. It’s pitched as an entry-level carbon road bike but that doesn’t mean it skimps on the quality componentry. The Garda comes with a full Ultegra 11-speed groupset, with hydraulic disc brakes and integrated handlebars. 

The Garda also has tyre clearance for up to 32mm, so could make a great year-round bike from speedy summer rides to wetter winter weather. 

  • Buy now from Merlin Cycles (£2,499)

Pinnacle Laterite 1 road bike 

Was £750, now £349 – save 53%

If you’re after a beginner road bike or just an everyday runaround, the Pinnacle Laterite 1 could be the bike. It has the option to fit mudguards or stick some chunky 32mm tyres on, and at £349 could be a great option for a new bike on a budget. 

  • Buy now from Evans Cycles (£349)

Cannondale Topstone carbon Rival AXS gravel bike

Was £4,850, now £3,250 – save 33%

Available in either black or olive green, the Cannondale Topstone carbon comes fully specced with a SRAM Rival eTap AXS 12-speed groupset for all your off-roading adventures. The Kingpin thru-axle pivot at the top of the seatstays provides a claimed 30mm compliance for added comfort on rougher trails. 

The Topstone is fitted with 44mm Vittoria Mezcal III tyres and DT Swiss G540 rims, as well as a Fizik Aliante Delta saddle and Cannondale SmartSense lights for added versatility. 

  • Buy now from Evans Cycles (£3,250)

Specialized Diverge E5 Elite gravel bike 2022

Was £2,200, now £1,539 – save 30%

The Specialized Diverge E5 Elite is a robust aluminium gravel bike complete with a mechanical Shimano GRX 10-speed groupset. With frame mounts on the top tube, forks and stays, the Diverge can be set up for out-and-out gravel rides or as a full-laden bike-packing steed. 

The Diverge E5 comes specced with 38mm Specialized Pathfinder tyres but has clearance for up to 700 x 47mm or 650b x 2.1″ for gnarlier terrain. 

  • Buy now from Evans Cycles (£1,539)

Clothing

Bell Tracker helmet

 

Was £36.99, now £13.00 – Save 64%

Need a cheap helmet to abuse for commuting purposes? The Bell Tracker isn’t a thing of stunning beauty but it meets the same safety standards as every other respectable bike helmet, and you won’t feel bad about strapping it your rucksack when it’s barely more than a tenner.

  • Buy now from Wiggle (£13)

Poc Omne Air SPIN helmet

Was £140, now £56 – save 60%

Not content to use the popular MIPS technology, Poc created its own protection system – SPIN, standing for Shearing Pad INside. It aims to combat rotational impacts using thicker protection zones and special pad technology to disperse impact.

The Omne Air borrows its comfort and ventilation features from the Octal and Ventral race helmets and comes here in a funky blue block colourway. It’s also 60% off so should soften the blow on your wallet as well as your head.

  • Buy now from Wiggle (£56)

GripGrab Cloudburst Waterproof Mid-season gloves

Was £71.95, now £27 – save 62%

Yes that is 62% off. GripGrab’s accessories are the ultimate solution to cold and wet hands and feet and the Cloudburst gloves are fully waterproof and windproof while still being breathable and touchscreen-compatible.

They’re also designed to not be too bulky like many cold-weather cycling gloves, to ensure the rider can still feel their handlebars, brakes and shifters. Plus it’s a bargain.

  • Buy now from Wiggle (£27)

Sportful Supergiara women’s short sleeve jersey

Was £110, now £33 – save 70%

Summer is peaking over the horizon and with it, warmer weather and warmer riding. The Sportful Supergiara women’s short sleeve jersey is designed for gravel riding, with six pockets for ultimate storage capacity, and uses silicone grippers to keep it in place over bumpier terrain. 

Available in three different colours with a YKK zipper and reflective detailing, the Supergiara jersey is currently 70% off, and could be a great storage solution for those longer gravel rides. 

  • Buy now from Merlin Cycles (£33)

Castelli Perfetto RoS Light men’s short sleeve jersey

Was £170, now £62.50 – save 63%

The RoS range from Castelli is well-known for its balance between weather protection and breathability. The Perfetto Light short sleeve jersey uses Gore-Tex Infinium fabric to provide water-resistance and a covered YKK zipper for ventilation.

Castelli’s Nano Flex Light fabric is used on the rear panel, and a dropped tail has been included for added protection from road spray. 

  • Buy now from Merlin Cycles (£62.50)

MAAP Women’s Ascend Pro rain jacket

Was £260, now £119 – save 54%

MAAP is currently offering up to 50% off a wide range of kit in its archive sale, and the women’s Ascend Pro rain jacket could be the perfect antidote to those soggy spring rides.

The Ascend Pro rain jacket has a 45K waterproof rating, is windproof and has thermo-taped seams. The bright colours offer great visibility in darker conditions and the jacket also features reflective logo transfers.

The dropped back of the jacket uses silicone grippers to hold it in place and the elasticated cuffs help keep the sleeves in place, protecting you from the elements.

  • Buy now from MAAP (£119)

Dhb Aeron Lab men’s thermal jersey

Was £120, now £45 – save 62.5%

Dhb is currently offering big discounts on this thermal jersey, part of its technical clothing collection, Aeron Lab.

The jersey features a durable water repellent (DWR) coating, and Dhb says it’s suitable for conditions between 8 and 15 degrees C. By using GREENSOUL fabric, from Miti Spa, Dhb says this thermal jersey is not only good technically but ethically as well, as it is said to use 100% sustainable recycled fabrics finished with environmentally-friendly techniques.

  • Buy now from Wiggle (£45)

Sportful Tempo women’s jacket

Was £190, now £46 – save 76%

Made from Gore-Tex Infinium, Sportful says that the Tempo women’s jacket is both windproof and water-resistant. The bright colour and reflective highlights are designed to help with visibility in low lights, and it has an iridescent graphic on the upper chest. Simple and understated, the Tempo women’s jacket could be a good staple for mid-range riding temperatures.

  • Buy now from Sigma (£46)

Specialized S-Works 7 lace road shoes

Was £300, now £150 – save 50%

Preaching the minimalist mantra, these Specialized S-Works 7 lace-ups are part of the brand’s performance range. Specialized says that the laces give a more even hold, with better levels of adjustability than other designs.

The S-Works 7s feature Specialized’s FACT Powerline carbon sole and PadLock heel technology, and are available in black at 50% off.

  • Buy now from Sigma (£150)

Accessories

Elite Custom Race Plus resin bottle cage

Was £14, now £8.99 – save 36%

While a bottle cage may be an inconspicuous feature on your bike, a good cage is worth its weight in gold (not literally, sadly). We have a handy bottle cage guide put together and the Elite Custom Race Plus came out on top with a rating of 4.5 stars. 

The Custom Race bottle cage is made from fibreglass-reinforced polymer and has a self-adjusting front insert to accommodate a range of bottle sizes. 

  • Read our full Elite Custom Race bottle cage review
  • Buy now from Merlin Cycles (£8.99)

Bontrager Ion 120/Flare 1 light set

Was £30, now £19 – save 37%

Are you after a set of 50+ hour lights on a budget? The Bontrager Ion 120/Flare 1 lights might do the trick. With steady or flashing and high or low settings, running on AAA batteries, the lights have plenty of options to keep you riding in darker conditions.

  • Buy now from Sigma (£19)

SiS Go Isotonic energy gel 30 pack

Was £48, now £28.80 – save 40%

It’s always worth stockpiling gels. You’ll need them all year round and with the fact that they have such a long expiration date, you can just leave them at the back of the cupboard until such time you need them.

  • Buy from Wiggle (£28.80)

Scicon Aerotech Evolution X TSA bike travel case

Was £849, now £489.99 – save 42%

‘One of the best boxes out there’ is how our reviewer described this Scicon travel case, with one of the only downsides being its price. Shave a massive £359 off that price and you’ve got yourself a big-time saving.

It’s good quality and strong, fairly lightweight and easy to manouevre. The Aerotech even has two TSA locks to keep it secure when it’s out of sight or transported to the wrong destination.

  • Read our Scicon Aerotech Evolution X TSA review
  • Buy now from ProBikeKit (£489.99)

LifeLine Pro trainer table

Was £149.99, now £79.99 – save 46%

Whiling away long hours on the turbo can inevitably incur a chaotic tangle of cables and, if you aren’t lucky enough to have a dedicated screen set up, a laptop balanced precariously nearby. If this sounds like you, the LifeLine Pro trainer table could ease your woes.

With an inbuilt universal socket and 2 USB sockets on the table top, a 3m extension cable connects the table to your wall socket. It also features non-slip matting and a bottle holder.

The desk height is adjustable up to 1.27m and caster wheels allow the table to be easily moved, and then locked with a foot-brake.

  • Buy now from Wiggle (£79.99)
